name: Absolver Thrull
text:
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Absolver Thrull enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, destroy target enchantment.

name: Abyssal Nocturnus
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Abyssal Nocturnus gets +2/+2 and gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"I fear to keep an open mind, for there are those who would use it as a door to my soul."
—Voka Schlak,
Mauzam Asylum inmate, diary

name: Ætherplasm
text: Whenever Ætherplasm blocks a creature, you may return Ætherplasm to its owner's hand. If you do, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield blocking that creature.

editions.flavor: Its fickle form holds hints of a thousand former identities.

name: Agent of Masks
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: "You say that I am two-faced? Enough with the flattery. We have business to conduct."

name: Angel of Despair
text:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.

editions.flavor:
"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia

"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia, Boros archangel

name: Battering Wurm
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Battering Wurm's power can't block it.

name: Beastmaster's Magemark
text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
Whenever a creature you control that's enchanted becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

name: Belfry Spirit
text:
Flying
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Belfry Spirit enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

name: Benediction of Moons
text:
You gain 1 life for each player.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)
When the creature Benediction of Moons haunts dies, you gain 1 life for each player.

name: Bioplasm
text: Whenever Bioplasm attacks, exile the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, Bioplasm gets +X/+Y until end of turn, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.

name: Blind Hunter
text:
Flying
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Blind Hunter enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

name: Bloodscale Prowler
text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: It tracks its victims by the scent of their breath, preferring to dine on those who recently ate well.

name: Borborygmos
text:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"It's easy to see why those Gruul dirtbags follow him—the only orders he gives are ‘Crush them!' and ‘We eat!'"
—Teysa

name: Burning-Tree Bloodscale
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{2}{R}: Target creature can't block Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn.
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn if able.

name: Burning-Tree Shaman
text: Whenever a player activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: Gruul shamans are bent on punishing the civilized. Any act more complex than rubbing sticks together or eating with utensils is met with the stinging burn of their magic.

name: Castigate
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile that card.

editions.flavor:
"We have no need for military might. We wield two of the sharpest swords ever forged: Faith in our left hand, Wealth in our right."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council

"We have no need for military might. We wield two of the sharpest swords ever forged: Faith in our left hand, Wealth in our right."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council

name: Caustic Rain
text: Exile target land.

editions.flavor:
"Looking out the great windows of Vitu-Ghazi at the foundry stacks belching their smoke to the sky, I wonder when the sky will take its vengeance."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Cerebral Vortex
text: Target player draws two cards, then Cerebral Vortex deals damage to that player equal to the number of cards he or she has drawn this turn.

editions.flavor: Izzet brains and Izzet boilers: contents under pressure.

name: Conjurer's Ban
text:
Name a card. Until your next turn, the named card can't be played.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Orzhov faithful file past to have their minds purged of "impure" desires. There, the guiltwardens eliminate any thoughts of hope or self-sufficiency.

name: Crash Landing
text: Target creature with flying loses flying until end of turn. Crash Landing deals damage to that creature equal to the number of Forests you control.

editions.flavor:
"The other guilds think they're untouchable. It's time we brought them back down to earth."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Cremate
text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Death's embrace need not be cold.

"Without a body, the soul is helpless to fight the terms of our contracts."
—Somhaur, Orzhov pontiff
Cremation of the dead is not a religious ritual in Ravnica. It's a business designed to keep the Golgari from growing in numbers.

name: Cry of Contrition
text:
Target player discards a card.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)
When the creature Cry of Contrition haunts dies, target player discards a card.

name: Cryptwailing
text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:
"Piece the tragic notes together and is it not a melody?"
—Teysa

name: Crystal Seer
text:
When Crystal Seer enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{4}{U}: Return Crystal Seer to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Surprise is a useless, untidy emotion—the plaything of goblins and fools."

name: Culling Sun
text: Destroy each creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Who truly runs this city? Look to the sky on hallowed days, and see whose sigil is stamped clearly onto the heavens."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council

name: Daggerclaw Imp
text:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.

name: Debtors' Knell
text:
({W/B} can be paid with either {W} or {B}.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: One moment, conscious only of a sense of repose. The next moment, hearing the trudge of his own footsteps. He sighed and squinted into the glare ahead.

name: Djinn Illuminatus
text:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)
Flying
Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

name: Douse in Gloom
text: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Orzhov prisoners are steeped in a blackened brew that robs their souls of strength. Patriarchs drink that brew to extend their own lives.
The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.

name: Droning Bureaucrats
text: {X}, {T}: Each creature with converted mana cost X can't attack or block this turn.

editions.flavor: " . . . and you must also apply for an application license, file documents 136(iv) and 22-C and -D in triplicate, pay all requisite fees, request a . . ."

name: Drowned Rusalka
text: {U}, Sacrifice a creature: Discard a card, then draw a card.

editions.flavor: Lurking below the current, she thirsts until others come to drink.

name: Dryad Sophisticate
text: Nonbasic landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a nonbasic land.)

editions.flavor: From Tin Street to the Outcast Mansions, she walks unbidden and unbound, her graceful silence never shaken by the riot of city life around her.

name: Dune-Brood Nephilim
text: Whenever Dune-Brood Nephilim deals combat damage to a player, put a 1/1 colorless Sand creature token onto the battlefield for each land you control.

editions.flavor: When it awoke, it spawned nameless thousands to herald its arrival.

name: Earth Surge
text: Each land gets +2/+2 as long as it's a creature.

editions.flavor:
"Some gardeners sing to plants. I tell them stories—stories of how they once ruled the world, of the mortals who destroyed their kind, and of revenge."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

name: Electrolyze
text:
Electrolyze deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.
The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.
The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.
The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.

name: Exhumer Thrull
text:
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Exhumer Thrull enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Fencer's Magemark
text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and have first strike.

editions.flavor:
"The first blow is the most important. It often negates the need for a second."
—Agrus Kos

name: Feral Animist
text: {3}: Feral Animist gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.

editions.flavor: He chanted over a pot of boiling blood and honey. His brain buzzed like a nest of hornets, and his muscles rippled with the might of the bear.
"Channeling the rage of the beast is the easy part. Explaining why you woke up with no memory in a pile of mangled lawmages—that's trickier."

name: Frazzle
text: Counter target nonblue spell.

editions.flavor: The chant was interrupted, the components cooked, and Zok worried that it was his brain he smelled smoking.

name: Gatherer of Graces
text:
Gatherer of Graces gets +1/+1 for each Aura attached to it.
Sacrifice an Aura: Regenerate Gatherer of Graces.

editions.flavor: "Garb is for common folk. I prefer to wear insight and zeal, ambition and flame."

name: Gelectrode
text:
{T}: Gelectrode deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may untap Gelectrode.

editions.flavor:
"Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

"Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale
text:
First strike
{3}{G}: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: At mealtimes, the Gruul customarily omit such niceties as using forks or killing the entrée.

name: Ghor-Clan Savage
text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: The snap of sinew. The crunch of bone. A cry for mercy. These are the music of the Gruul.
The snap of sinew. The crunch of bone. A cry for mercy. These are the music of the Gruul.

name: Ghost Council of Orzhova
text:
When Ghost Council of Orzhova enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Exile Ghost Council of Orzhova. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Ghost Warden
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Ghostway
text: Exile each creature you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"I watched its blade swing through me, but I was hollow, empty. I saw its face contort in rage but could not hear it snarl."
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire

name: Giant Solifuge
text:
({R/G} can be paid with either {R} or {G}.)
Trample; haste; shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Goblin Flectomancer
text: Sacrifice Goblin Flectomancer: You may change the targets of target instant or sorcery spell.

editions.flavor: Rerouting magic through a goblin's brain is the surest way to throw it wildly off course.

text:
({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)

name: Gruul Signet
text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:

name: Guardian's Magemark
text:

Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: The soldier moved with fluid poise, his awareness extending far beyond five senses.

text:
Flying

editions.flavor: Moon Market merchants sell a bottled scent to cutpurses and other criminals. Those doused in the liquid become "griffin bait."

name: Hatching Plans
text: When Hatching Plans is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw three cards.

editions.flavor: So wondrous to behold, so delicate and finely crafted—and yet, such a pleasure to smash.

name: Hissing Miasma
text: Whenever a creature attacks you, its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: All that remains when the fog finishes are neat piles of polished bones, like acid-etched glass. Orzhov servants collect them to make altar chimes.

name: Hypervolt Grasp
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
{1}{U}: Return Hypervolt Grasp to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Zap on. Zap off.

name: Infiltrator's Magemark
text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.

editions.flavor:
"In secrecy is strength. None can oppose one who cannot be found."
—Szadek

name: Ink-Treader Nephilim
text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, if that spell targets only Ink-Treader Nephilim, copy the spell for each other creature that spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.

editions.flavor: When it awoke, the mirrors of the world reflected only darkness.

editions.flavor: Where strength and humility converge.

editions.flavor: Where treachery and oblivion converge.

text:
Vigilance

name: Living Inferno

name: Martyred Rusalka
text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature can't attack this turn.

editions.flavor: Rakdos cultists hanged her for sport in the township square. Her ghost now stands vigil at what has become known as the Tree of Weeping.

editions.flavor: The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.
The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.
The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.

name: Ostiary Thrull
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: Orzhov churches don't pass the plate for collection. They charge for admission.

name: Parallectric Feedback
text: Parallectric Feedback deals damage to target spell's controller equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "You can't have so many people living so close together, all practicing so much magic, and not expect some feedback."

name: Petrahydrox
text:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)
When Petrahydrox becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Petrahydrox to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: It departs through the streets' fissures with a sound like gravel pouring into a pond.

name: Petrified Wood-Kin
text:
Petrified Wood-Kin can't be countered.
Bloodthirst X (This creature enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the damage dealt to your opponents this turn.)
Protection from instants

name: Pillory of the Sleepless
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life."

editions.flavor: Which is worse—the sleep which never ends or that which never comes?
Which is worse—the sleep which never ends or that which never comes?

name: Plagued Rusalka
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra

"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra

"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."

name: Poisonbelly Ogre
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Some claim it's a failed Simic experiment, others say a Golgari creation. Both guilds deny all responsibility, while secretly studying its strange virulence.

name: Predatory Focus
text: You may have creatures you control assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.

editions.flavor: Instinct blood-tinted his world until he could see only one thing clearly: his prey.

name: Primeval Light
text: Destroy all enchantments target player controls.

editions.flavor:
"Look to the old tomes, those bound in hides and written in yarberry ink. They hold the spells that can free us of the clutter of modern magecraft."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

name: Pyromatics
text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Quicken
text:
The next sorcery card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. (It can be cast any time you could cast an instant.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.
A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

name: Rabble-Rouser
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is Rabble-Rouser's power.

name: Repeal
text:
Return target nonland permanent with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."—Agosto, Azorius imperator

"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."

name: Restless Bones
text:
{3}{B}, {T}: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Restless Bones.

editions.flavor:
"We mourn our dead. We shroud our dead. We bury our dead. Too often, it seems, we must kill our dead again."
—Grazda, veteran armorer

name: Revenant Patriarch
text:
When Revenant Patriarch enters the battlefield, if {W} was spent to cast it, target player skips his or her next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.

editions.flavor: "The Golgari raise the bodies of their dead to serve. We raise the spirits of our dead to lead."

name: Rumbling Slum
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.

editions.flavor: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.
The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.

name: Runeboggle
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Ever try to count hyperactive schoolchildren while someone shouts random numbers in your ear? It's like that."
—Geetra, frustrated mage

name: Sanguine Praetor
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy each creature with the same converted mana cost as the sacrificed creature.

editions.flavor:
"Our fealty to guilds dooms us. The old gods shall resurface. Our skins will wave upon the guild-masts over emptied streets, and our bones will clatter in the wind."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Savage Twister
text: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.

editions.flavor:
"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—Travelogue of Najat

"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

editions.flavor: They inflict pain to forget their own and break foes to feel whole.

name: Schismotivate
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I ran the experiment through the brain of a schizophrenic lab-goblin. My burners' flames fell asleep while the beakers jumped about and shattered. Success!"
—Myznar, Izzet psychomancer

name: Scorched Rusalka
text: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.
Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.

text:

Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)

name: Shadow Lance

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.

editions.flavor: Shadow lances are crafted from harvested souls. The more wicked the sinner, the keener the blade.

Flying
When Shrieking Grotesque enters the battlefield, if {B} was spent to cast it, target player discards a card.

editions.flavor: Orzhov mage-sculptors bring their stone to life before they carve it. The shrieking begins as soon as the mouths are formed.

name: Siege of Towers
text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Target Mountain becomes a 3/1 creature. It's still a land.

name: Silhana Ledgewalker
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Silhana Ledgewalker can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: Street folk call them "spire mice," but behind the mockery is an unspoken envy of the ledgewalkers' skill at avoiding harm.

text:

{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: In light he finds both gift and weapon.

name: Sinstriker's Will
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature."

editions.flavor: "Steel rusts. Arrows break. But righteousness is always strong, always sharp."

name: Skyrider Trainee
text: Skyrider Trainee has flying as long as it's enchanted.

editions.flavor: "Of course I plan on going up. Kang here is the most trusted 'fin on the squad. Afraid? Me? No, I'm just . . . waiting for the right wind conditions."

name: Sky Swallower
text:
Flying
When Sky Swallower enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of all other permanents you control.

editions.flavor: Would you trade the world for such a pet?

name: Smogsteed Rider
text: Whenever Smogsteed Rider attacks, each other attacking creature gains fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"An entire order of mages who draw their power from Ravnica's smog? Yet another indicator of our world's decay."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

name: Souls of the Faultless
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Souls of the Faultless is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life and attacking player loses that much life.

editions.flavor:
"More horrible than their empty forms are their noble eyes. I dare not strike."
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire

name: Spelltithe Enforcer
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

editions.flavor: His assistants calculate the amount of the tribute. He measures out the punishment for delinquency.

name: Starved Rusalka
text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"No more wretched fate is there than to waste away. If you are slain, your ghost may at least avenge itself upon your killer. But what release is there for one slain by Time?"
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Steamcore Weird
text: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

name: Steam Vents
text:
({T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.)
As Steam Vents enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Steam Vents enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Crafted with genius, energized with madness.

name: Stitch in Time
text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one.

editions.flavor: Quyzl was told by his mentor to "make more time" for his studies.

name: Stomping Ground
text:
({T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.)
As Stomping Ground enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Stomping Ground enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"Roots, ruins, and room to fight. All the comforts of home."
—Domri Rade

name: Storm Herd
text: Put X 1/1 white Pegasus creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield, where X is your life total.

editions.flavor:
"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor

"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor

name: Stratozeppelid
text:
Flying
Stratozeppelid can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: The "Days of Darkness" mark the stratozeppelids' annual migration, when for five days they blot out the sun and trumpet their passing.
The Orzhov run a construction unit whose only business is rebuilding the wreckage left in the wake of wurms. When business is slow, they pay Golgari carnomancers to lure the wurms to the surface.

text:
Whenever you cast a blue spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Tibor and Lumia deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

editions.flavor: Tracing the horizon in a dance of wind and fire.

name: Tin Street Hooligan
text: When Tin Street Hooligan enters the battlefield, if {G} was spent to cast Tin Street Hooligan, destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: "Rauck-Chauv's like a holiday! Only it isn't on the calendars, and instead of dancing you knock people flat, and instead of giving gifts you break stuff."

name: To Arms!
text:
Untap all creatures you control.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The call came, spell-borne through mortar and stone to the ear of every soldier. The call came, and the advantage was ours."
—Lodusz, captain of the watch

name: Torch Drake
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Torch Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Drakes? Bah! Things that breathe don't interest me. It breathes fire, you say? Well, that's a different story!"
—Zataz, Izzet clockwork artificer
